lines.text: [last lines]

Little girls, this seems to say / Never stop upon your way / Never trust a stranger friend / No-one knows how it will end / As you're pretty, so be wise / Wolves may lurk in every guise / Now as then, 'tis simple truth / Sweetest tongue has sharpest tooth.
Never stray from the path, never eat a windfall apple and never trust a man whose eyebrows meet in the middle.
And that's all I'll tell you, cause that's all I know.
Your only sister, all alone in the wood, and nobody there to save her. Poor little lamb.
Why couldn't she save herself?
You pay too much attention to your granny. She knows a lot but she doesn't know everything. And if there's a beast in men, it meets its match in women too.
And then they lived happily ever after?
Indeed they did not!

[pushes him away as they near a kiss]
Jesus, what big teeth you have!

[smiles deviously]
All the better to eat you with.
[Rosaleen shoots his arm with a rifle making him scream and writhe in pain turning into a wolf]

[hears wolves howl]
Who's come to sing us carols, then?
Only my companions, darling. I love the company of wolves. Look out of the window and you'll see them.

[does so]
Poor creatures. It's freezing cold out there. No wonder they howl so.

[after the huntsman turns into a wolf from being shot, tearfully]
I'm sorry. I never knew a wolf could cry.
A daughter is one thing, a heifer is another!
So I wasn't good enough for you? I was once. Once upon a time! Don't you remember? Well, don't you? The Wolves in the forest are more decent!
Get ye back to Hell from whence ye came!
I don't come from Hell, I come from the forest.
What have you done with my Granddaughter?

[with annoyance in his voice]
Nothing she didn't want!

[to wolf-girl]
Are you God's work, or the Devil's? Oh, what do I care whose work you are? You poor, silent creature.
[binds her wound]
It will heal. In time.
[repeated line]
Seeing is believing.

[a lock of Granny's hair singes in the fireplace]
Is that all you left of her? Your kind can't stomach hair, can you? Even if the worst wolves are hairy on the inside.
What do you know about my kind?

[takes out a knife]
My Granny told me plenty!
[the huntsman restrains her]
Are you very much afraid?
It wouldn't do me much good to be afraid, would it? My, what big eyes you have.
All the better to see you with.
They say seeing is believing, but I'd never swear to it.
They say the Prince of Darkness is a gentleman. And as it turns out, they're right; a fine gentleman.
I'd never let a man strike me.
Oh, they're nice as pie until they've had their way with you. But once the bloom is gone... oh, the beast comes out.

[to the villagers about to shoot Rosaleen as a wolf]
DON'T SHOOT! DON'T SHOOT!
[after the bride's husband decapitates the wolf's head]

[sees the head turn into a man's face in the milk, sadly]
He looks just the same! As the day I married him!
[the bride's husband goes angry and slaps her very hard]

[knocks on the door]
They want you downstairs! You have to come out sometime; you can't sulk in there forever! Open the door! You've been at my lipstick too, haven't you? Pest!
[Rosaleen is shown tossing and turning in bed]
What makes you so different anyway, Buck-Teeth? Come on out, pest! It's not because I want you; it's because mummy wants you. Pest, pest, pest...
